intro: Blighia wildemaniana, commonly known as the wild mango, is a tropical tree native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, simple leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are followed by edible, orange-colored fruits resembling small mangoes. Its fruit contains a single seed enclosed in a fleshy, aromatic pulp. Due to its ornamental value and potential nutritional benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical regions.
